Increase heat to medium-high. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned. Add cinnamon, cumin and cloves. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato, passata, capsicum, vinegar, bay leaves, raisins, beans, olives and ½ cup water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened. Sprinkle with coriander. Serve with corn and sour cream.']

foodname: Almond-crusted chicken with miso pumpkin mash
ingredient: ['750g peeled pumpkin, cut into 2cm cubes', '55g (1/2 cup) almond meal', '2 tbsp gluten-free cornflour', '1 tbsp sesame seeds', '1/2 tsp Chinese five spice', '80ml (1/3 cup) reduced-fat coconut milk', '8 (500g) chicken tenderloins, trimmed', '2 tsp olive oil', '2 tsp white miso paste', '200g snow peas, steamed, to serve', '1 bunch broccolini, steamed, to serve', 'Lemon wedges, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place pumpkin on prepared tray. Spray with oil. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender.', 'Meanwhile, combine the almond meal, cornflour, sesame seeds and five spice in a large shallow dish. Place coconut milk in a seperate shallow dish. Working with 1 tenderloin at a time, dip into milk to coat, allow excess to drip off and then coat in almond mixture. Place on prepared tray. Repeat with remaining tenderloins.', 'Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 2-3 minutes each side, until cooked through.', 'Process the pumpkin and miso paste in a food processor until smooth. Season.', 'Serve the crumbed chicken with the miso pumpkin mash, steamed snow peas and broccolini, and lemon wedges.']

ingredient: ['3 bunches baby broccoli', '100g brown mushrooms, halved', '1 flat mushroom, thickly sliced', '350g mixed medley tomatoes', '2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced', '1 tsp dried chilli flakes (optional)', '2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '1/4 cup (60ml) balsamic vinegar', '2 x 250g pkts Coles 7 Ancient Grains microwavable rice', '60g pkt Coles Australian Baby Rocket']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place baby broccoli, combined mushroom and tomatoes on the lined tray. Sprinkle with garlic and chilli, if using. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Season. Roast, tossing halfway through cooking, for 15 mins or until vegetables are tender.', 'Meanwhile, heat the rice following packet directions. Transfer to a serving plate.', 'Arrange the vegetable mixture and rocket over the rice. Drizzle with the juices from the baking tray.']

foodname: Barbecued steaks with grilled summer salad
ingredient: ['1/3 cup (80ml) dry red wine', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '2 tsp dried thyme', '1/4 cup (60ml) olive oil', '4 Coles Australian Beef Fillet Steaks', '200g cup mushrooms, halved', '2 bunches asparagus, trimmed, halved lengthways', '150g green beans, trimmed', '200g cherry tomatoes', '2 tsp wholegrain mustard', '2 tsp balsamic glaze', '120g pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach', 'Coles Bakery Stone Baked White Sourdough Vienna, sliced, chargrilled, to serve']
steps: ['Combine 1/4 cup (60ml) of the wine with the garlic, 1 tsp of the thyme and 1 tbsp of the oil in a medium bowl. Season. Add the steaks and turn to coat. Heat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium-high. Cook the steaks for 3 mins each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest.', 'Combine 1 tablespoon of the remaining oil with the mushroom, asparagus, green beans, tomatoes and remaining thyme in a bowl. Season. Cook the mushroom mixture on the grill for 2 mins or until just tender. Set aside for 5 mins to cool.', 'Meanwhile, combine the remaining oil, remaining wine, mustard and vinegar in a large bowl. Season.', 'Add the mushroom mixture and spinach to the dressing. Toss to combine. Divide the mushroom salad among serving bowls. Top with the steaks and serve with bread.']

ingredient: ['1/3 cup cocoa powder, sifted', '2 litres reduced-fat milk', '1/3 cup caster sugar', '2 cinnamon sticks']
steps: ['Place cocoa and 1/2 cup milk in a large jug. Whisk until smooth. Gradually whisk in remaining milk. Pour into a saucepan. Add sugar and cinnamon sticks. Heat over medium heat until almost boiling. Remove from heat. Stand for 10 minutes.', 'Remove and discard cinnamon sticks. Heat over medium heat until warm. Pour into warmed, heatproof cups. Serve.']

foodname: Pulled lamb and warm lentil salad
ingredient: ['2 red onions, cut into wedges', '1 tbsp olive oil', '2.5kg Coles Australian Lamb Whole Leg Roast', '1 cup (250ml) chicken stock', '400g can lentils, rinsed, drained', '350g mixed medley tomatoes, halved', '60g pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach', '1 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 150C. To make the spice mix, combine paprika, coriander, chilli, cumin, ginger, allspice, cardamom, nutmeg and cloves in a bowl. Season.', 'Arrange onion in the base of a large roasting pan. Stir the oil into the spice mix. Spread evenly over lamb to coat. Place lamb over the onion in the pan. Pour stock around the lamb and cover the pan tightly with foil.', 'Roast, basting the lamb occasionally with the pan juices, for 4 hours or until the lamb is almost falling off the bone. Uncover the pan and increase oven to 180°C. Roast for 30 mins or until the lamb is golden brown.', 'Arrange lentils, tomato and spinach around the lamb in the pan. Roast for 10 mins or until the lentil mixture is heated through. Loosely cover pan with foil and set aside for 10 mins to rest.', 'Coarsely shred the lamb, discarding the bone. Arrange the lentil salad in a serving dish. Top with lamb and sprinkle with parsley.']

ingredient: ['2 cinnamon sticks', '2 whole cloves', '1 vanilla bean, split', '1 orange, thinly sliced', '1/2 cup caster sugar', '750ml bottle dry red wine', 'Halved orange slices, to serve']
steps: ['Place cinnamon sticks, cloves, vanilla bean, orange slices, sugar and wine in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer. Simmer for 10 minutes or until fragrant and sugar has dissolved. Cover. Set aside for 10 minutes to let flavours develop.', 'Strain mixture into a heatproof jug. Pour into warmed glasses. Top with halved orange slices. Serve.']

ingredient: ['150g unsalted butter, melted', '2 tsp lemon rind, finely grated', '2 tbsp lemon juice', '1/3 cup fresh passionfruit pulp', '1 cup caster sugar', '3/4 cup self-raising flour', '1 1/4 cups milk', '4 eggs, separated', 'Double cream, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 1.5-litre (6-cup-capacity) baking dish.', 'Place butter, lemon rind, lemon juice, passionfruit pulp, sugar, fl our, milk and egg yolks in a bowl. Whisk to combine.', 'Using an electric mixer, beat egg whites on high speed until soft peaks form. Using a metal spoon, fold 1/4 of the egg white into lemon mixture. Gently fold in remaining egg white.', 'Spoon mixture into prepared dish. Place dish in a large roasting pan. Pour boiling water into pan to come halfway up side of dish. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden and just set (see Notes).', 'Meanwhile, make meringue using an electric mixer, beat egg whites on high speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly until sugar dissolves and mixture is thick and glossy.', 'Preheat grill on high. Remove pudding from water bath. Dollop meringue over pudding. Grill for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden (see Notes). Serve immediately with cream.']

ingredient: ['2 tsp vegetable oil', '1 medium red onion, cut into wedges', '1 garlic clove, crushed', '2 tbsp mild curry paste', '1 medium red capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces', '300g cauliflower, cut into small florets', '150g button mushrooms, quartered', '2 baby eggplant, sliced', '415g can crushed tomatoes', '1 cup vegetable stock', '150g green beans, trimmed', '400g can brown lentils, drained, rinsed', 'Fresh coriander leaves, to serve', 'Plain yoghurt, to serve', 'Steamed rice, to serve']
steps: ['Heat oil2 tsp vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 medium red onion, cut into wedges and garlic1 garlic clove, crushed. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Add curry paste2 tbsp mild curry paste. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant.', 'Stir in capsicum1 medium red capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces, cauliflower300g cauliflower, cut into small florets, mushroom150g button mushrooms, quartered, eggplant2 baby eggplant, sliced, tomato415g can crushed tomatoes and stock1 cup vegetable stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add beans150g green beans, trimmed and lentils400g can brown lentils, drained, rinsed. Cook for 3 minutes or until beans are tender and lentils heated through.', 'Serve with corianderFresh coriander leaves, to serve, yoghurtPlain yoghurt, to serve and riceSteamed rice, to serve.']

ingredient: ['2 x 335g 95.5% fat-free thin pizza bases', '140g tub pizza sauce', '200g light shaved ham', '1/4 pineapple, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces', '150g button mushrooms, finely sliced', '1 tsp dried mixed Italian herbs', '1 cup grated low-fat mozzarella cheese', '100g baby spinach, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 250°C. Place pizza bases onto 2 baking trays. Spread with sauce.', 'Scatter ham, pineapple, mushrooms and herbs over bases. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes, swapping trays after 8 minutes, or until bases are crisp.', 'Cut pizzas into slices. Serve with spinach.']

ingredient: ['600g (3 cups) vanilla ice-cream, slightly softened', '2 1/2 tsp imitation rum essence (Queen brand)', '1 x 380g pkt (six slices) fresh pineapple slices', '140g (2/3 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar']
steps: ['Combine ice-cream and rum essence in a metal bowl. Place in the freezer.', 'Preheat grill on high. Place a wire rack over a baking tray. Cut 2 slices of pineapple in half through the centre. Place all slices in a single layer, on the rack. Sprinkle evenly with half the sugar. Cook under grill for 2-3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and pineapple browns. Turn and sprinkle with remaining sugar. Cook for a further 2-3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and pineapple browns. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool.', 'Serve pineapple slices with a large scoop of rum ice-cream.']

ingredient: ['2 x 200g packets rice stick noodles', '2 1/2 tbsp peanut oil', '1kg chicken mince', '3 lemongrass stalks, white part only, finely chopped', '4 garlic cloves, crushed', '5cm piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped', '2 tbsp kecap manis', '4 gem lettuces, finely shredded', '1 cup fresh Thai basil leaves, plus extra to serve', '1/4 cup salted roasted peanuts, chopped', 'Lime wedges, to serve']
steps: ['Make Chilli Lime Dressing; Place sugar and boiling water in a heatproof screw-top jar. Secure lid. Shake until sugar dissolves. Remove lid. Add lime juice, fish sauce and chilli sauce. Secure lid. Shake until combined. Set aside until required.', 'Cook noodles following packet directions. Drain. Transfer to a bowl. Add 2 teaspoons oil. Toss well to coat. Cover to keep warm.', 'Heat a wok over high heat. Add 1/2 of the remaining oil. Swirl to coat. Stir-fry mince, in 3 batches, breaking up lumps with a wooden spoon, for 3 to 5 minutes or until browned and just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl.', 'Heat remaining oil in wok. Swirl to coat. Add lemongrass, garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until fragrant. Return mince to wok. Stir-fry to combine. Add kecap manis and 1/2 the dressing. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Add noodles and toss. Remove from heat.', 'To serve, add lettuce and basil to larb. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Sprinkle with peanuts and extra basil. Serve with lime wedges.']

foodname: Wood-roasted garlic with soft cheese and bread
ingredient: ['4 garlic bulbs', '4 thyme sprigs', '1/3 cup (80ml) extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve', "250g soft fresh goat's cheese or ricotta", '1 loaf wood-fired bread, thickly sliced']
steps: ["Using a sharp knife, cut the top off each garlic bulb to expose tops of the cloves. Don't remove the papery skin.", 'Cut out 4 large squares of foil and place a garlic bulb and a sprig of thyme on each. Drizzle each with 1 tablespoon oil, season with salt and pepper, then wrap tightly. Place in the fire and roast for 30 minutes. Alternatively, place on a baking tray and roast in an oven preheated to 180°C for 35 minutes.', 'To serve, peel away papery garlic skin, squeeze out the soft cloves, then mash. Spread garlic onto bread slice, top with cheese, season with pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Serve immediately.']

ingredient: ['2L (8 cups) apple juice', '2 x 7cm cinnamon sticks, lightly crushed', '6 whole cloves', '4 strips orange peel', '4 strips lemon peel', '2 granny smith apples, peeled, cored, thinly sliced', 'Ice cubes, to serve']
steps: ['Place the apple juice, cinnamon, cloves and combined peel in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until aromatic. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool. Transfer to an airtight container and place in the fridge for 2 hours to chill.', 'Strain the juice into a jug. Divide the apple and ice among serving glasses. Pour over the juice and serve.']

foodname: Tuna, broad bean and risoni salad
ingredient: ['2 cups frozen broad beans', '1 1/2 cups dried risoni', '425g can Greenseas tuna chunks in springwater', '250g fresh ricotta, crumbled', '2 tsp finely grated lemon rind', '1/4 cup lemon juice', '1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '2 tbsp chopped fresh mint leaves', '2 tbsp fresh mint leaves, to serve']
steps: ['Place broad beans in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 5 minutes. Peel and discard skins.', 'Cook risoni in a saucepan of boiling, salted water until tender, adding broad beans in the last minute of cooking. Drain well. Transfer to a heatproof bowl.', 'Add drained tuna, ricotta, lemon rind, juice, oil and mint to pasta. Season. Toss to combine. Serve sprinkled with mint leaves.']

foodname: Lebanese roast salmon and cauliflower salad
ingredient: ['135g (3/4 cup) fine grit burghul', '1/2 (about 550g) cauliflower, cut into small florets', '1 red onion, cut into wedges', '2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra, to serve', '1 tsp sumac, plus extra, to serve', '1 tsp ground cumin', '1 tsp ground coriander', '1 lemon, rind finely grated, halved', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '2 large (about 470g) salmon fillets', '130g (1/2 cup) Greek yoghurt', '1 tbsp tahini', '1 tbsp water', '1 cup fresh mint leaves', '1 cup fresh coriander leaves']
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 210°C/190°C fan forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Place the burghul in a bowl and cover with cold water. Set aside for 30 minutes to soak. Drain. Place in a clean tea towel. Squeeze out excess moisture. Transfer to a bowl.', 'Meanwhile, place the cauliflower and onion on 1 prepared tray. Drizzle with 1 1/2 tbs oil. Season. Combine the sumac, cumin and coriander in a bowl. Sprinkle the vegetables with 1 tsp spice mixture. Roast, stirring once, for 25 minutes or until golden.', 'Add the rind, 1 garlic clove and the remaining oil to the remaining spice mixture. Place the salmon on the remaining prepared tray. Season. Spread with the spice mixture. Roast salmon for the last 12 minutes of vegetable cooking time or until cooked to your liking. Rest for 3 minutes. Coarsely flake.', 'Juice half the lemon. Combine the yoghurt, tahini, water, 1 1/2 tbs lemon juice and remaining garlic in a bowl. Season. Chop three-quarters of the herbs. Add vegies and chopped herbs to the burghul. Toss to combine. Divide among plates. Top with the salmon. Drizzle with the dressing and extra oil. Sprinkle with remaining herbs and extra sumac. Serve with remaining lemon.']

ingredient: ['1 tbsp vegetable oil', '1 medium brown onion, finely chopped', '1 tsp curry powder', '360g chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, halved', '1 litre chicken stock', '1 small granny smith apple, peeled, grated', '2/3 cup red lentils, rinsed', '270ml can coconut milk', '1 tbsp lemon juice', 'Fresh coriander leaves, to serve', 'Pappadums, to serve']
steps: ['Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add curry powder. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until fragrant.', 'Add chicken. Turn to coat. Add stock. Cover. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 30 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through.', 'Transfer chicken to a bowl. Cool slightly. Using a fork, shred chicken. Return chicken to pan. Add apple, lentils and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer. Simmer, partially covered, for 15 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in lemon juice. Season with pepper. Ladle into bowls. Top with coriander. Serve with pappadums.']

ingredient: ['500g thick beef or pork sausages', '5 chat potatoes, washed and quartered', '1 large red onion, cut into thin wedges', '1 tbsp olive oil', '1 cup plain flour', '1 egg', '1 cup milk', '1 tbsp grain mustard']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine sausages, potatoes and onion in a 26cm x 19cm base measurement ovenproof lasagne dish. Drizzle with oil and toss until well combined. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until sausages start to brown.', 'Sift flour into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Combine egg and milk and stir into flour. Add mustard and season.', 'Pour batter over sausage mixture. Shake dish to distribute evenly. Bake a further 40 to 45 minutes or until batter is golden and well-risen. Cut into squares. Serve with steamed shredded cabbage, if desired.']

foodname: Roast lamb with chickpea puree and mint sauce
ingredient: ['1/2 cup (125ml) olive oil', '2 tsp ground cumin', '1 tsp ground coriander', '1 lemon, zested and juiced', '2.5kg Coles Australian Whole lamb leg roast', '2 x 400g cans chickpeas, drained', '1 garlic cloves, crushed', '2 tbsp sour cream', '1/3 cup fresh mint leaves, finely chopped', '1/2 tsp caster sugar', '1 tbsp lemon juice, extra', 'Coles Brand Australian Baby Spinach and Red Beetroot Salad Leaves, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180C. Combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon cumin, coriander and lemon zest in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Rub marinade all over the lamb. Place the lamb in the roasting pan and roast in oven for 2 hours. Cover and set aside for 15 mins to rest.', 'Meanwhile, process the chickpeas, garlic, sour cream, 2 tablespoons of the remaining olive oil, 2 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/2 cup (125ml) water and remaining cumin in a food processor until a puree forms. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Combine the remaining olive oil, mint, sugar and extra lemon juice to make a dressing.', 'Slice the lamb and serve with the chickpea puree, mint dressing and salad.']

ingredient: ['1 tbsp oil', '1 onion, halved, sliced', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '1 small red chilli, finely chopped', '600g chicken tenderloins, chopped', '2 tbsp brown sugar', '1 lime, juiced', '2 tsp fish sauce', '1 cup torn fresh mint leaves', '1 baby cos lettuce, leaves separated', "4 Patak's chapatti wraps"]
steps: ['Heat the oil in a wok over a medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic and chilli, and cook for 3 minutes or until golden. Add the chicken and increase the heat to high. Stir-fry for 5 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through.', 'Add the brown sugar, lime juice and fish sauce. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Toss the mint leaves through the chicken and serve with the lettuce and chapatti wraps.']

ingredient: ['1 tbsp olive oil', '800g chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, cut in half', '1 brown onion, thinly sliced', '2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced', '1/4 tsp ground cinnamon', '1/4 tsp ground turmeric', 'Pinch ground nutmeg', '2/3 cup chicken stock', '2 tbsp honey', '1 1/2 cups wholemeal couscous', '1 1/2 cups boiling water', '1/2 pomegranate, seeds dislodged (see Note)', '1/2 cup walnuts, toasted', 'Steamed green beans, to serve', '1/2 cup fresh mint leaves']
steps: ['Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Season chicken800g chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, cut in half and cook in 2 batches for 4 minutes or until well browned (this will give you a rich dark sauce). Set aside. Reduce heat to medium-high and cook onion1 brown onion, thinly sliced, stirring, for 3 minutes or until browned. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced and spices1/4 tsp ground cinnamon|1/4 tsp ground turmeric|Pinch ground nutmeg and cook stirring for 1 minute. Return chicken to pan with stock2/3 cup chicken stock and honey2 tbsp honey. Bring to a simmer. Gently simmer, turning chicken to coat occasionally, for 5 minutes or until sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.', 'Meanwhile, place couscous1 1/2 cups wholemeal couscous and boiling water1 1/2 cups boiling water in a heatproof bowl. Season with salt and stir. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff up grains with a fork.', 'Add pomegranate1/2 pomegranate, seeds dislodged (see Note) and walnuts1/2 cup walnuts, toasted t chicken. Serve chicken with couscous and green beansSteamed green beans, to serve. Sprinkle with mint1/2 cup fresh mint leaves.']

ingredient: ['4 eggs', '350g caster sugar', '30g unsalted butter, chopped', 'Zest and juice of 1 lemon', '1 tbsp cornflour', '1 tsp white vinegar']
steps: ['Carefully remove the top of each egg using a serrated knife. Separate the eggs by passing them through your fingers and letting the eggwhite drip through your fingers into a bowl. Place yolks in a heatproof bowl. Wash out eggshells, then dry carefully with paper towel. Set aside.', "Add 100g sugar, butter, zest and juice to the bowl with the yolks, then whisk until just combined. Set the bowl over a pan of simmering water (don't let the bowl touch the water). Stir gently with a wooden spoon for 6-8 minutes until the butter has melted and the lemon curd mixture has thickened. Cool.", 'Half-fill each egg shell with some of the cooled lemon curd. Place in ovenproof egg cups, then refrigerate while you make the meringue.', 'Preheat the oven to 220°C. Place the eggwhites in the bowl of an electric mixer with another 1/2 cup (110g) of the sugar and beat until soft peaks form. With the motor running, slowly add the remaining sugar until mixture is stiff and glossy, then beat in the cornflour and vinegar.', 'Place meringue mixture in a piping bag fitted with a fluted nozzle, then pipe meringue into eggshells, about 3cm above the top. Place egg cups on a tray, then bake for 5 minutes until the meringue is crisp and tinged golden. Serve immediately.']

foodname: Lamb wellington pops with minted pea smash
ingredient: ['8 lamb cutlets, French trimmed', '4 sheets frozen puff pastry, partially thawed', '40g quince paste, cut into 5g slices', '1 egg, lightly whisked']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan forced. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Spray lamb with oil. Season. Cook, in 2 batches, or 30 seconds each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel.', 'Use an 9cm round cutter to cut 8 discs from pastry. Use a 10cm round cutter to cut 8 discs from remaining pastry. Divide the 9cm discs among 2 lined baking trays. Top each round with a lamb cutlet and a slice of quince paste. Top each cutlet with a 10cm disc. Press to seal and crimp the edges. Brush with egg. Season with pepper. Bake for 14 minutes or until golden.', 'Meanwhile, for pea smash, heat butter in the frying pan over medium heat. Add shallot and stir for 2 minutes or until soft. Stir in peas for 5 minutes or until tender. Cool for 2 minutes. Stir in mint and crème fraiche. Season. Use a potato masher to coarsely mash.', 'Divide among plates and top with lamb.']

ingredient: ['1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve', '100g (6 rashers) Coles Australian Made Thin Sliced Streaky Bacon', '6 fresh marjoram sprigs', '1 onion, chopped', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '1kg potatoes, peeled, cut into 3cm cubes', '1 tbsp vegetable stock powder', '1.2L (6 cups) water', '65g (1/4 cup) light sour cream, plus extra to serve', 'Chargrilled crusty bread, to serve']
steps: ['Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook, stirring, for 4-6 minutes, or until crisp. Add the marjoram and cook for a further minute. Transfer the bacon and marjoram to a plate and keep warm.', 'Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the potato and cook, stirring, for a further 2 minutes. Add the stock powder and water. Bring to the boil and cook for 20 minutes, or until potato is tender. ! Remove 1 cup of the potato and set aside. Remove soup from heat and add the sour cream. Use a stick blender to blend the soup until smooth. Season with pepper.', 'Divide the reserved potato between serving bowls. Top with soup. Sprinkle over bacon and marjoram and top with a dollop of sour cream. Drizzle with extra olive oil and season with pepper, if desired. Serve with crusty bread.']

ingredient: ['1/3 cup raisins', '1 cup (150g) self-raising flour', '1/4 cup dark cocoa', '2/3 cup caster sugar', '1/3 cup milk', '1 egg, lightly beaten', '80g melted butter, cooled', '100g dark chocolate, roughly chopped', '1 1/4 cups (310ml) boiling water', '1/3 cup (80ml) rum', '1/2 cup caster sugar, extra', '1 tbsp dark cocoa, extra']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180°C. Scatter raisins into an 8 cup ovenproof dish. Sift flour and cocoa together. Add caster sugar and make a well in the centre.', 'Add milk, egg and melted butter. Stir until just smooth. Stir in chocolate. Spoon the mixture over the raisins and smooth the surface.', 'Whisk boiling water, rum, extra sugar and cocoa in a jug. Carefully pour the mixture over the back of a spoon onto the cake mixture. Place the dish on an oven tray and bake for 35-40 minutes. Serve immediately.']

foodname: Chicken cooked in a salt crust
ingredient: ['3 cups (450g) plain flour, plus extra to dust', '100g sea salt', '2 tbsp thyme leaves', '2 eggs', '1 tbsp chopped rosemary', '1 tbsp grated lemon zest', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '1 tbsp olive oil', '4 chicken breasts, skin on']
steps: ['Place the flour in a bowl with the sea salt, half the thyme leaves, 1 beaten egg and 175ml of cold water. Mix into a dough, then form into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 200°C.', 'Meanwhile, combine the remaining thyme leaves, chopped rosemary, lemon zest, garlic and olive oil. Massage the mixture all over each chicken breast.', 'Divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll out each piece on a lightly floured board. Wrap each piece of pastry around a chicken breast, sealing it all the way around. Place on a greased baking tray. Beat remaining egg and use to brush the tops of the parcels. Bake the chicken parcels in the oven for 20 minutes, then remove from oven and allow to rest for 10 minutes.', 'Serve with mashed potato and steamed green vegetables.']

ingredient: ['1L (4 cups) milk', '200g (1 cup) medium-grain rice', '1/4 tsp salt', '110g (1/2 cup) caster sugar', '1 tsp vanilla essence', 'Ground nutmeg, to serve']
steps: ['Place the milk1L (4 cups) milk, rice200g (1 cup) medium-grain rice and salt1/4 tsp salt in a large saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring, for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender.', 'Add the sugar110g (1/2 cup) caster sugar and vanilla1 tsp vanilla essence. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to the boil. Boil for a further 5-8 minutes or until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens.', 'Spoon the rice evenly among serving bowls. Sprinkle with nutmegGround nutmeg, to serve and serve immediately.']

ingredient: ['700g sweet potato, peeled, grated', '1 egg, beaten', '1/4 cup plain flour', '60g unsalted butter, melted', '60ml (1/4 cup) olive oil']
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 150°C. Mix sweet potato with the egg, flour and melted butter. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Form the mixture into 6 patties and fry, in batches, for 2-3 minutes each side until crisp and golden. (Keep each batch warm in the oven.) Serve with the lamb.']

ingredient: ['6 Arnott’s Salada Original Crispbread', '160g (1 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar', '125g salted butter, chopped', '2 x 180g blocks dark chocolate, melted', '100g white chocolate, melted', '50g green and red M&M’s Minis', 'Silver cachous, to decorate']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180/160 fan forced. Line a 20 x 30cm slice pan with baking paper, allowing the paper to overhang the 2 long sides. Place crispbread6 Arnott’s Salada Original Crispbread over the base of the prepared pan in an even layer.', 'Combine the sugar160g (1 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar and butter125g salted butter, chopped in a small saucepan. Cook, stirring, over medium heat until butter melts and the mixture is smooth. Bring to the boil. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until thickened.', 'Pour the sugar mixture evenly over the crispbread. Place in the oven and bake for 5 minutes or until sugar mixture is bubbling.', 'Pour the dark chocolate2 x 180g blocks dark chocolate, melted over the crispbread and use a palette knife to smooth. Set aside until set.', 'Drizzle over white chocolate100g white chocolate, melted and sprinkle with M&M’s and50g green and red M&M’s Minis cachousSilver cachous, to decorate. Set aside until set completely. Break into pieces to serve.']

['Sift the flour into a large bowl. Stir in the yeast. Stir in the salt and sugar until combined. Make a well in the centre. Pour in the water and oil. Stir until just combined. Use your hands to bring the dough together.', 'Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 5 minutes. Drizzle extra oil into a large clean bowl. Add dough and turn to coat. Cover with a clean tea towel. Set aside in a warm draught-free place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.', 'Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Brush a 23cm tart tin with melted butter.', 'Knead the dough briefly in the bowl to knock out the air. Place on a floured surface. Halve dough. Roll out 1 half to a 23cm disc. Press into base and side of the prepared tin. Brush well with butter. Sprinkle with half the sugar. Roll out the remaining dough. Place on top of the first disc. Set aside for 20 minutes to rise slightly.', "Combine the goat's curd with remaining sugar. Spread over the dough. Top with the peaches. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until crisp and golden. Scatter with pistachio. Drizzle with maple syrup. Top with flowers, if using."]

ingredient: ['1 (about 500g) eggplant, halved lengthways, cut into 1cm-thick slices', '4 zucchini, ends trimmed, thickly sliced lengthways', '1 tbsp olive oil', '200g mixed olives', '200g semi-dried tomatoes', '50g drained baby bocconcini', '10 slices prosciutto', '10 slices mild salami', '5 marinated artichokes, quartered', 'Mini grissini sticks, to serve']
steps: ['To make the baked ricotta, preheat oven to 180°C. Brush two 250ml (1-cup) capacity ramekins with oil to grease. Combine the ricotta, egg and garlic in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon into ramekins and smooth the surface. Bake for 30 minutes or until just set. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool.', 'Meanwhile, preheat a chargrill pan on high. Brush the eggplant and zucchini with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add one-quarter of the vegetables to the grill and cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until tender. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat with remaining vegetables. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool.', 'Turn the ricotta out onto a serving platter. Arrange the eggplant, zucchini, olives, semi-dried tomatoes, bocconcini, prosciutto, salami and artichokes on the platter. Serve with grissini sticks.']

ingredient: ['400g trussed cherry tomatoes', '1 tbsp balsamic vinegar', '1/2 cup (125ml) extra virgin olive oil', '1/2 cup basil leaves', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '1/4 cup (40g) slivered almonds', '1/4 cup (20g) finely grated parmesan', '4 (about 800g) desiree potatoes, peeled', '40g butter', '1/2 cup (125ml) thin cream', '4 (about 200g each) blue-eye trevalla fillets', 'Steamed green beans, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 160°C. Place the tomatoes on an oven tray and drizzle with vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in oven for 15 minutes or until tomatoes begin to collapse.', 'Place the basil, garlic, almonds and parmesan in the bowl of a food processor and process until fi nely chopped. With the motor running, add 1/3 cup of the remaining oil in a thin, steady steam.', 'Meanwhile, place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Place over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Return to the pan with the butter and cream. Use a potato masher to mash until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Add to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden brown and just cooked through.', 'Spoon the mash onto serving plates. Top with fish and dollop with pesto. Place the beans on serving plates, top with tomatoes and drizzle with pan juices. Serve immediately.']

ingredient: ['1 cup brown sugar', '300ml thickened cream', '60g butter, chopped', '1 tsp vanilla essence', '450g Madeira cake', '1 cup vanilla custard', '4 bananas, halved, sliced diagonally', '2 tbsp chocolate sprinkles']
steps: ['Combine sugar, cream, butter and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until sauce comes to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Pour caramel into a heatproof bowl or jug. Refrigerate until cool and thickened.', 'Trim brown edges from all sides of cake and discard. Cut cake into 1cm-thick slices. Using a 4cm star biscuit cutter, cut 2 stars from each slice of cake.', 'Place half the stars in bowls. Drizzle over half the custard. Top with half the banana. Drizzle over 2 tablespoons caramel. Sprinkle over half the chocolate sprinkles. Repeat with remaining stars, custard, banana and caramel.', 'Top with remaining chocolate sprinkles and serve.']

foodname: Pork and olive rolls in cherry tomato sauce
ingredient: ['70g (1/4 cup) olive tapenade', '2 x 385g pork scotch fillet schnitzels', '160g pkt baby spinach leaves', 'Olive oil spray', '3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced', '250ml (1 cup) water', '420g jar tomato pasta sauce', '500g baby potatoes, red and white, halved', 'Handful fresh basil leaves']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan forced. Spread olive tapenade70g (1/4 cup) olive tapenade over pork2 x 385g pork scotch fillet schnitzels. Top with half the spinach160g pkt baby spinach leaves. Roll up and secure with toothpicks.', 'Spray an ovenproof frying pan with olive oil and heat over medium heat. Cook pork, turning, for 2-3 minutes or until browned. Stir in garlic3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced for 1 minute. Add water250ml (1 cup) water and tomato sauce420g jar tomato pasta sauce. Cover and transfer to the oven. Bake for 1 hour. Add potatoes500g baby potatoes, red and white, halved. Cook, covered, for 30 minutes. Stir through remaining spinach. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes, or until wilted. Sprinkle with the basilHandful fresh basil leaves.']

ingredient: ['200g digestive biscuits', '5 x 43g Kinder Bueno Chocolate Bars', '100g butter, melted', '60ml (1/4 cup) boiling water', '2 1/2 tsps gelatine powder', '180g pkt milk chocolate, chopped', '500g cream cheese, at room temperature, chopped', '100g (1/2 cup) caster sugar', '2 tsps vanilla extract', '375ml (1 1/2 cups) thickened cream', 'Cocoa powder, to dust', '2 x 43g Kinder Bueno Chocolate Bars, broken into small pieces']
steps: ['Line the base and sides of a 20cm springform pan with baking paper.', 'Place the biscuits200g digestive biscuits and 1 Kinder Bueno bar (2 sticks) in a food processor. Process until fine crumbs form. Add the butter100g butter, melted and process until combined. Transfer to prepared pan. Use a straight-sided glass to spread and press the biscuit mixture firmly over the base of the pan. Place in the fridge until required.', 'Place the boiling water60ml (1/4 cup) boiling water in a small heatproof jug. Sprinkle with the gelatine2 1/2 tsps gelatine powder. Whisk with a fork until dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly.', "Place the milk chocolate180g pkt milk chocolate, chopped in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water (don't let the bowl touch the water). Stir with a metal spoon until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.", 'Place the cream cheese500g cream cheese, at room temperature, chopped, sugar100g (1/2 cup) caster sugar and vanilla2 tsps vanilla extract in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add 250ml (1 cup) of the cream375ml (1 1/2 cups) thickened cream and process until combined. Add melted chocolate and process until combined. Add gelatine mixture and process until combined.', 'Pour half the cheesecake mixture into the prepared pan. Arrange rows of other 4 Kinder Bueno bars, about 1.5cm apart, trimming to fit, over cheesecake mixture. Top with remaining cheesecake mixture. Smooth top. Place in the fridge for 4 hours or overnight until set.', 'Remove cheesecake from the pan and place on a serving plate. Use electric beaters to beat the remaining 125ml (1/2 cup) cream until soft peaks form. Top cheesecake with cream. Dust with cocoaCocoa powder, to dust and decorate with remaining Kinder Bueno bars. Serve.']

foodname: Lemon chicken with potatoes and peas
ingredient: ['olive oil cooking spray', '4 (180g each) chicken breast fillets, trimmed', '375ml Chicken stock', '1 lemon, rind finely grated, juiced', '4 medium desiree potatoes, thinly sliced', '3/4 cup frozen peas', '1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped']
steps: ['Heat a large, heavy-based, non-stick saucepan over high heat. Spray chicken lightly with oilolive oil cooking spray. Cook chicken4 (180g each) chicken breast fillets, trimmed for 1 minute each side or until just golden. Remove to a plate.', 'Add stock375ml Chicken stock, 1/4 cup lemon juice and potatoes to saucepan. Season with salt and pepper. Top potatoes4 medium desiree potatoes, thinly sliced with chicken. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender.', 'Add peas3/4 cup frozen peas and 1/3 cup parsley. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until peas are tender.', 'Remove chicken to a plate. Slice each breast into quarters. Spoon potato mixture onto plates. Top with chicken. Drizzle with pan juices. Combine remaining parsley and lemon rind. Sprinkle over chicken. Serve.']

ingredient: ['1 1/2 tbsp olive oil', '600g chicken tenderloin fillets, sliced', '1 carrot, thinly sliced', '175g pouch MasterFoods Honey Mustard Chicken Recipe Base', '100ml light cream', 'Steamed jasmine rice, to serve', '1/4 cup coriander leaves, to serve']
steps: ['Heat oil in a medium non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add chicken and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until brown. Add carrot and cook for 1 minute.', 'Stir in recipe base and cream and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.', 'Serve chicken with steamed rice and coriander leaves, if desired.']

ingredient: ['200g wheatmeal or Granita biscuits', '1/4 cup ground almonds', '1 tbsp caster sugar', '100g butter, melted', '4 eggs, lightly beaten', '395g can condensed milk', '2/3 cup (160ml) cream', 'Zest and juice of 4 limes']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 170°C. Line base of a 20cm springform tin with baking paper.', 'Process biscuits200g wheatmeal or Granita biscuits until fine crumbs. Add almonds1/4 cup ground almonds, sugar1 tbsp caster sugar and butter100g butter, melted, process until combined. Press mixture firmly into the base and 3cm up sides of tin. Refrigerate.', 'Whisk eggs4 eggs, lightly beaten, milk395g can condensed milk, cream2/3 cup (160ml) cream, lime rind and juiceZest and juice of 4 limes until smooth. Pour into biscuit crust.', 'Place on tray and bake for 40-45 mins or until set. Cool. Serve with extra lime slices.']

ingredient: ['400g orange sweet potato (kumara)', '4 (about 420g) parsnips', '1 tbsp olive oil', 'Salt & freshly ground black pepper', '3 15g pkts sesame seeds', '4 (about 200g each) single chicken breast fillets', '420g green beans, topped', '85g (1/3 cup) Delikatess mayonnaise (Thomy Brand)', '1 tbsp fresh lemon juice']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 220°C. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper.', 'Cut sweet potato crossways into 1.5cm-thick slices and slice the parsnip diagonally into 1.5cm-thick slices. Place sliced vegetables and oil in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Arrange vegetables in a single layer on a lined tray. Roast in preheated oven for 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, toast sesame seeds in a medium non-stick frying pan over medium heat, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate or a sheet of baking paper. Pat each chicken fillet onto sesame seeds, turning, until well coated. Place coated chicken on remaining lined tray.', 'Place the tray of coated chicken in the oven with the vegetables and cook for a further 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is just cooked through.', 'While the chicken and vegetables are cooking, cook the green beans in a medium saucepan of boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain. Combine the mayonnaise and lemon juice in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper.', 'Cut the chicken into thick slices. Serve immediately with roasted vegetables, green beans and drizzled with the lemon mayonnaise.']

ingredient: ['3 sheets frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, partially thawed', '2 tsp olive oil', '200g chicken mince', '2 green onions, thinly sliced', '3 eggs', '1/2 cup pure cream', '1/2 x 340g bottle asparagus, drained, trimmed, cut into 1cm pieces', '125g can corn kernels, drained', '1/3 cup grated tasty cheese']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Grease a 12-hole, 1/3 cup-capacity muffin pan. Cut each pastry sheet into 4 squares. Press 1 square into each pan hole.', 'Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add mince and onion. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 3 to 4 minutes or until mince is browned.', 'Whisk eggs and cream together in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Divide mince mixture between pan holes. Top with asparagus, corn and egg mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and filling is set. Serve.']

ingredient: ['2 tbsp fresh breadcrumbs', '120g fresh ricotta', '75g frozen chopped spinach, thawed, excess liquid removed', '40g (1/2 cup) shredded parmesan', '65g chargrilled capsicum, finely chopped', '250g dried thin spaghetti pasta', '400g can chopped tomatoes with paste', '80g pancetta slices, finely chopped', '2 tbsp water']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180°C. Bake the breadcrumbs on a baking tray for 5 minutes or until dry but not browned.', 'Combine the ricotta, spinach, 2 tablespoons parmesan and 50g of the capsicum in a bowl. Season.', 'Cook the pasta in a saucepan of boiling water until al dente. Drain. Arrange in lengths on a baking tray. Set aside for 10 minutes to dry slightly.', 'Meanwhile, to make the bechamel sauce, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until foaming. Add the flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the mixture bubbles. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in the milk until smooth. Stir over medium heat until the sauce thickens. Stir in the chives and 2 tablespoons of remaining parmesan. Season. Cover the surface of the bechamel with plastic wrap to prevent a skin forming.', 'Combine the tomato, pancetta and water in a jug. Season. Pour into a 5cm-deep, 25cm round baking dish.', 'Spray pasta lightly with olive oil. Divide into 8 portions. Twirl 1 portion around your fingers to make an 8cm nest. Carefully place on a chopping board. Repeat with remaining pasta. Divide ricotta mixture into 8 portions. Press into the centres of the nests.', 'Carefully arrange nests in the dish. Spoon bechamel sauce over the filling. Top with remaining capsicum. Combine breadcrumbs and remaining parmesan and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden.']

ingredient: ['9kg cooked leg ham', '2/3 cup maple syrup', '2/3 cup caster sugar', '1/4 cup wholegrain mustard', '320g packet Lucky Natural Californian Walnuts']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced.', 'Using a small sharp knife, cut around the ham shank about 10cm from the end. Carefully run the knife under the rind, around the edge of the ham. Gently lift off the rind in 1 piece by running your fingers between the rind and the fat. Discard the rind. Place ham on a lightly greased wire rack in a large roasting pan. Pour enough boiling water into pan to reach 2cm up side of pan', 'Stir maple syrup, sugar and mustard in a small saucepan over low heat until sugar dissolves. Brush the ham with half the maple mixture to evenly coat. Secure ham hock with foil to prevent burning and bake for 1 hour or until golden brown.', 'Meanwhile, chop walnuts until finely chopped (alternatively pulse in a food processor).', 'Brush ham with half the remaining maple mixture. Carefully press walnuts over ham to secure. Bake for a further 20 to 30 minutes or until golden. Rest for 15 minutes. Remove and discard foil from shank. Serve drizzled with remaining maple mixture.']

foodname: Chicken, makrut lime and lemon-grass salad
ingredient: ['2 tsp vegetable oil', '2 long fresh red chillies, deseeded, finely chopped', '1 stem lemon grass, pale section only,finely chopped', '500g lean chicken mince', '1 small red onion, finely sliced', '3 makrut lime leaves, centre vein removed, finely shredded', '60ml (1/4 cup) fresh lime juice', '2 tsp fish sauce', '2 tsp brown sugar', '1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves', '1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, torn', '1 iceberg lettuce, leaves separated, washed, dried', 'Steamed Basmati rice, to serve']
steps: ['Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the chilli and lemon grass and stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic.', 'Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through.', 'Transfer the chicken mixture to a large heatproof bowl. Add the onion and makrut lime and stir until well combined.', 'Whisk lime juice, fish sauce and sugar in a jug until the sugar dissolves. Add to the chicken mixture with the coriander and mint and combine. Arrange the lettuce leaves on serving plates. Spoon the chicken mixture among lettuce leaves. Serve with rice.']

foodname: Chocolate puddings with salted caramel filling
ingredient: ['10g butter, melted (for greasing)', '200g 70% cocoa dark chocolate, chopped', '150g butter, chopped', '1/3 cup brown sugar', "1/4 cup Nestle Top 'n' Fill", '1/2 tsp sea salt flakes', '4 eggs, lightly beaten', '1/4 cup plain flour', '2 tsp icing sugar mixture', '6 scoops vanilla ice-cream, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Grease six 4.5cm-deep, 8cm (base), 1/2-cup-capacity ovenproof ramekins with melted butter. Line bases with baking paper. Place on a baking tray.', 'Place chocolate, butter and sugar in a large heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water (make sure base of bowl does not touch water). Heat, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until melted and smooth. Remove bowl from heat and set aside to cool for 2 minutes.', "Meanwhile, combine Top 'n' Fill and salt in a small bowl (don’t overmix).", 'Add eggs to chocolate mixture, whisking until combined. Sift over flour. Whisk until combined. Reserve 1/4 cup of batter. Divide remaining batter evenly among prepared ramekins. Gently spoon 2 teaspoons caramel mixture into the centre of each pudding (caramel mixture will slowly sink into batter). Top each pudding with 2 teaspoons of reserved batter. (If making ahead, see Notes)', 'Bake puddings for 12 minutes or until a crust has formed on top, but puddings are still wobbly to touch in the centre. Remove from oven. Stand to cool for 2 minutes. Run a small knife around edge of puddings. Gently turn puddings onto serving plates. Serve immediately with a dusting of icing sugar and ice-cream.']

foodname: Zucchini and bacon fritters with garlic yoghurt
ingredient: ['2 medium zucchini, grated', '1 medium desiree potato, peeled, grated', '4 shortcut bacon rashers, trimmed, finely chopped', '1/4 cup plain flour', '1 egg, lightly beaten', '2 tbsp chopped fresh chives', 'Vegetable oil, for shallow frying', 'Chopped chives, to serve']
steps: ['Squeeze excess moisture from zucchini. Drain on paper towel. Combine zucchini2 medium zucchini, grated, potato1 medium desiree potato, peeled, grated, bacon4 shortcut bacon rashers, trimmed, finely chopped, flour1/4 cup plain flour, egg1 egg, lightly beaten and chives2 tbsp chopped fresh chives in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Heat oilVegetable oil, for shallow frying in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Spoon 1/4 cup zucchini mixture into pan, pressing to flatten. Repeat to make 3 more fritters. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden underneath. Turn, pressing again to flatten. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat process with remaining mixture.', 'Meanwhile, make Garlic yoghurt: Combine garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and yoghurt1/2 cup Greek Style Yoghurt in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle fritters with extra chivesChopped chives, to serve. Serve with garlic yoghurt.']

ingredient: ['150g milk chocolate', '150g dark chocolate', '150g white chocolate', '750g large strawberries, washed, dried']
steps: ['Line a baking tray with baking paper. Break milk chocolate into even pieces. Place into a heat-proof bowl.', "One-third fill a saucepan with water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Place chocolate bowl over saucepan (don't let bowl touch water). Stir with a metal spoon until smooth.", 'Dip one-third of the strawberries into chocolate. Place onto tray. Repeat with dark and white chocolate. Refrigerate until set.']

ingredient: ['4 (about 150g each) salmon fillets, skin on', '1 tsp cumin seeds', '2 limes, juiced', '2 tsp brown sugar', '2 tsp fish sauce', '1 tsp finely grated ginger', '1 tsp sesame oil', '2 Ruby Red grapefruits or pomelos, peeled, segmented', '2 limes, extra, peeled, segmented', '2 Lebanese cucumbers, peeled into ribbons', '1 cup mint leaves', '1/2 cup coriander leaves', '1 red onion, thinly sliced', '1 long red chilli, thinly sliced (optional)', '1/2 cup (75g) cashews, toasted, coarsely chopped']
steps: ['Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray both sides of the salmon with olive oil spray and season. Sprinkle both sides of salmon with cumin seeds. Cook, skin-side down, for 2 mins or until skin is crisp. Turn and cook for a further 2-3 mins for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest.', 'Meanwhile, combine lime juice, sugar, fish sauce, ginger and oil in a small jug.', 'Combine grapefruit or pomelo, lime segments, cucumber, mint, coriander, red onion and chilli, if using, in a bowl. Drizzle with dressing. Toss to combine. Divide among serving plates. Top with salmon. Sprinkle with cashew.']

ingredient: ['250ml (1 cup) Vegetable stock', '2 red onions, chopped', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '3 medium (about 660g) red capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces', '2 medium (about 440g) green capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces', '2 medium (about 700g) eggplant, cut into 3cm pieces', '3 x 400g cans whole peeled tomatoes', '70g (1/4 cup) tomato paste', '2 tsp caster sugar', '4 (about 320g) zucchini, quartered, cut into 2cm pieces', '1 cup roughly chopped fresh basil leaves', 'Salt & freshly ground black pepper']
steps: ['Bring the stock250ml (1 cup) Vegetable stock to the boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium, add onions2 red onions, chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until the onions soften slightly.', 'Add capsicums3 medium (about 660g) red capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces and eggplant2 medium (about 700g) eggplant, cut into 3cm pieces, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes3 x 400g cans whole peeled tomatoes, tomato paste70g (1/4 cup) tomato paste and sugar2 tsp caster sugar. Cover and cook over low heat for 40 minutes.', 'Stir in zucchini4 (about 320g) zucchini, quartered, cut into 2cm pieces. Cook, covered, for 20 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in basil1 cup roughly chopped fresh basil leaves. Taste and season with salt and pepperSalt & freshly ground black pepper.']

foodname: Mustard dill pikelets with smoked trout and avocado salad
ingredient: ['1 cup (150g) self-raising flour', '1 egg', '1 tbsp wholegrain mustard', '1 cup (250ml) buttermilk', '2 tbsp chopped dill', '2 tbsp lemon juice', '2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '400g smoked ocean trout fillet, skin removed, coarsely flaked', '2 small ripe avocados, halved, stoned, peeled, coarsely chopped', '2 cups watercress sprigs', 'Creme fraiche, to serve']
steps: ['Sift the flour into a medium bowl and make a well in the centre. Whisk the egg, mustard, buttermilk and half the dill in a small jug. Season with salt and pepper. Gradually add egg mixture to flour and whisk until a smooth batter forms.', 'Combine the lemon juice, oil and remaining dill in a small jug. Season with salt and pepper. Combine the trout, avocado and watercress in a medium bowl and set aside.', 'Spray a medium non-stick frying pan with cooking spray or lightly oil and place over medium heat. Drop two 1/4 cups (60ml) of batter into pan, allowing room for spreading. Cook for 20 seconds or until bubbles appear on the surface and base is golden. Turn and cook for a further 20 seconds or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Regrease pan and repeat with remaining batter in 3 more batches.', 'Drizzle the lemon dressing over the trout mixture and gently toss to combine. Place the pikelets on serving plates. Top with trout salad and a dollop of creme fraiche. Serve immediately.']

ingredient: ['30g (1/4 cup) walnuts', '70g (1/3 cup) couscous', '80ml (1/3 cup) boiling water', '1 1/2 tbsp toasted slivered almonds', '30g butter, melted', '1 1/2 tbsp brown sugar', '1 1/2 tbsp currants', 'Large pinch of ground cinnamon', '6 large red apples', 'Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt, to serve']
steps: ['Place the walnuts in a small frying pan over medium-low heat and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until toasted.', 'Preheat oven to 180°C. Place the couscous in a heatproof bowl and pour over the water. Set aside for 5 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Use a fork to separate the grains.', 'Place the walnuts and almonds in the bowl of a food processor and process until finely chopped. Combine the couscous, butter, sugar, currants, cinnamon and walnut mixture in a bowl.', 'Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Use a knife to remove the top of each apple and place on the lined tray. Use an apple corer to remove cores from apples. Use a teaspoon to scoop out the flesh to create a 4cm cavity, keeping the cavity narrow at the base. Cut a horizontal slit around the centre of each apple, being careful not to cut all the way through (this will prevent the apple skin from splitting during cooking). Place upright in a baking dish.', 'Divide the couscous mixture among the apple cavities. Bake for 20 minutes. Add the baking tray with the apple tops to the oven and bake with the whole apples for a further 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, to make the honey syrup, place the water, honey, sugar, cardamom seeds and cinnamon stick in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar dissolves. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes or until syrup thickens. Set aside to cool.', 'Place 1 apple and a dollop of yoghurt on each serving plate. Replace the tops. Spoon over the honey syrup to serve.']

ingredient: ['1 cup Coles caster sugar', '1 cup water', '1 pineapple, peeled, cored and chopped', '1 cup Coles passionfruit pulp', '270ml light coconut milk', 'Lime slices, to serve', 'Malibu liqueur, to serve (optional)']
steps: ['Combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan, and stir over low heat, without boiling, until sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil and cook for 2 mins, then remove from heat and set aside to cool.', 'Place pineapple pieces in a food processor and puree until smooth. Place in a sieve. Using the back of a spoon, press over a bowl to extract as much juice as possible. Discard pineapple pulp.', 'Combine cooled syrup, pineapple juice, passionfruit pulp and coconut milk. Pour into a large, shallow plastic container. Cover tightly and freeze overnight.', 'To serve, use a fork to scrape the frozen mixture and spoon into serving glasses (it will melt down to a “slushy” consistency in the glass). Garnish with a small lime slice and add a splash of Malibu to each glass, if you like.']

foodname: Slow cooker lamb ragu with pappardelle
ingredient: ['2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '2 lamb shanks', '1 red onion, halved, sliced', '1 fennel bulb, trimmed, diced', '3 garlic cloves, sliced', '1 dried bay leaf', '1 sprig fresh rosemary', '1/3 cup red wine', '400g can cherry tomatoes', '1 1/2 cups Massel Vegetable Liquid Stock', '250g packet dried pappardelle', 'Finely grated parmesan, to serve']
steps: ['Heat half the oil in flameproof slow- cooker bowl or large deep frying pan over high heat. Season lamb with salt and pepper. Add to bowl. Cook for 2 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Discard oil and wipe bowl clean.', 'Heat remaining oil in bowl over medium- high heat. Add onion, fennel, garlic, bay leaf and rosemary. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add wine. Boil over high heat for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and stock. Season with salt and pepper. Return lamb to bowl. Transfer bowl to slow cooker. Cover. Cook on HIGH for 3 hours.', 'Discard rosemary and bay leaf. Transfer lamb to a board. Add pasta to sauce, pushing pasta into sauce. Cover and cook on HIGH for 18 minutes. Meanwhile, using 2 forks, shred meat. Discard bones. Return lamb to slow cooker. Toss to combine.', 'Serve ragu sprinkled with parmesan.']

foodname: Leek, goat's cheese and olive free-form tarts
ingredient: ['Olive oil spray', '2 sheets (29 x 29cm) Pampas frozen ready-rolled shortcrust quiche pastry, just thawed', '60ml (1/4 cup) olive oil', '1kg leeks, pale section only, washed, dried, halved lengthways, thinly sliced', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '1 tbsp chopped fresh thyme', '2 eggs, lightly whisked', "2 x 100g pkts goat's cheese, crumbled", '40g (1/2 cup) shaved parmesan', '80g (1/2 cup) pitted black olives', 'Fresh thyme leaves, extra, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 220°C. Spray a baking tray with olive oil spray to lightly grease. Using a 28cm-diameter plate as a guide, cut 1 disc from each sheet of pastry.', 'Heat the oil in a frying pan over low heat. Add the leek, garlic and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the leek has softened and is brown. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool.', "Combine the egg, goat's cheese and two-thirds of the parmesan in a large bowl. Stir in the leek mixture.", 'Divide the egg mixture evenly among the pastry sheets, leaving a 4cm border. Fold in the edges of the pastry discs to partially enclose the filling, leaving the centres open. Place on the prepared tray. Sprinkle the olives evenly over the tarts and top with remaining parmesan.', 'Bake in oven for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden and crisp. Set aside for 1 hour to cool. Sprinkle with extra thyme and serve.']

ingredient: ['2 tsp olive oil', '1 brown onion, thinly sliced', '550g Coles Finest by Laurent Rye Sourdough Vienna', '1 tbsp Dijon mustard', '1 Beurre Bosc pear, thinly sliced', '1/2 cup (60g) grated vintage cheddar', '1/2 cup (50g) grated mozzarella', '1 tbsp thyme leaves', '2 tsp honey', 'Extra honey, to serve', 'Extra thyme leaves, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with 2 large pieces of foil.', 'Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring, for 5 mins or until soft.', 'Slice the bread at 1.5cm intervals (don’t cut the all the way through). Spread each slice with a little mustard. Fill cuts with onion, pear, cheddar, mozzarella and thyme and drizzle with honey.', 'Wrap the loaf in foil to enclose. Bake for 20 mins or until cheese melts. Uncover and bake for a further 5 mins or until top is crisp. Drizzle with extra honey and sprinkle with extra thyme.']

foodname: Spicy prawn, wombok and shredded pea salad
ingredient: ['1/2-1 tsp dried red chilli flakes, to taste', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', '2 tbsp lime juice', '1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '500g green prawns, peeled, tails intact', '1/2 small wombok, trimmed, finely shredded', '1 bunch baby pak choy, trimmed, shredded', '100g snow peas, trimmed, thinly sliced', '100g sugar snap peas, trimmed, halved', '200g mixed grape tomatoes, halved', '1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, shredded', '1 tbsp salt reduced tamari', '2 tsp brown sugar', 'Lime wedges, to serve']
steps: ['Combine chilli, garlic, 1 tbs lime juice and 2 tsp oil in a glass dish. Add prawns. Stir to coat. Set aside for 10 minutes, to marinate.', 'Meanwhile, place wombok, pak choy, snow pea, sugar snap pea, tomato and mint in bowl. Whisk tamari, sugar and remaining lime juice and oil in bowl. Add to salad. Toss to combine.', 'Heat a chargrill over high heat. Spray with olive oil. Cook prawns for 1-2 minutes each side or until just cooked through.', 'Divide salad among plates. Top with prawns. Serve with lime wedges.']

ingredient: ['1kg Greek-style natural yoghurt', '300ml olive oil', '3 garlic cloves, bruised', '3 x 2cm-thick strips lemon rind', '2-3 small sprigs fresh rosemary']
steps: ['Spoon the yoghurt into a fine sieve. Place over a bowl. Cover and place in the fridge overnight to drain.', 'Roll the yoghurt into walnut-sized balls. Place in a serving bowl. Cover with the oil and add the garlic, lemon rind and rosemary.']

ingredient: ['Melted butter, to grease', '200g butter, at room temperature', '170g (3/4 cup) caster sugar', '2 eggs, at room temperature', '150g (1 cup) self-raising flour', '150g (1 cup) plain flour', '185ml (3/4 cup) milk', '230g (1 1/2 cups) fresh blackberries or frozen blackberries', 'Pauls vanilla custard, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180C. Brush a round 22cm (base measurement) springform pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line the base and side with non-stick baking paper.', 'Use an electric beater to beat the butter and sugar in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the combined flour and milk and use a large metal spoon to fold until well combined. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan and use the back of the spoon to smooth the surface. Arrange the blackberries, in a single layer, over the top.', 'To make the crumble topping, place the flour in a bowl. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Stir in the coconut and sugar.', 'Sprinkle the crumble topping over the blackberries. Bake for 1 hour. Cover loosely with foil. Bake for a further 25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Set aside in the pan for 10 minutes to cool before transferring to a wire rack to cool slightly.', 'Cut the cake into wedges and serve with the custard.']

ingredient: ['10 ginger thins (see note)', '1/4 cup (90g) honey', '4 scoops vanilla ice cream', '1L (4cups) milk', '1 tsp vanilla extract', '1 tsp ground cinnamon, plus cinnamon quills to serve', '1/2 tsp ground ginger', '1-2 tbsp treacle or golden syrup']
steps: ['Whiz the biscuits to fine crumbs in a food processor, then transfer to a plate. Place honey on a separate plate. Dip the rim of 4 glasses in honey, then in crumbs. Chill to firm up while you make the milkshakes.', 'Blend remaining ingredients, except cinnamon quills, in a blender until smooth and combined, then pour into the glasses. Serve with cinnamon quills.']

foodname: Chicken, leek and mushroom pot pies
ingredient: ['1 tbsp olive oil', '750g Coles RSPCA Approved Chicken Breast Fillets, skin off, cut into 2cm pieces', '20g butter', '1 leek, trimmed, thinly sliced', '200g cup mushrooms, quartered', '1/3 cup (80ml) white wine', '1 tbsp plain flour', '1 cup (250ml) chicken stock', '2/3 cup (160ml) Bulla Light Thickened Cream for Cooking', '1 tbsp wholegrain mustard', '1/2 cup frozen peas', '1 Coles Australian Free Range Egg, lightly beaten', '1 sheet ready-rolled frozen puff pastry, thawed', 'Steamed greens, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200C. Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large frying over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, stirring, for 3-5 mins or until browned. Transfer to a plate.', 'Heat remaining oil and butter in the pan. Add the leek and mushroom. Cook, stirring, for 3-5 mins or until mushroom is golden. Add wine and cook for 2 mins or until reduced by half. Add flour and cook for 1-2 mins. Gradually add combined stock and cream, stirring. Stir in the mustard and peas. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 2-3 mins or until thickened slightly. Return chicken to the pan and season with salt and pepper.', 'Spoon the chicken mixture into four 1 1/2 cup (375ml) capacity ramekins. Cut four 11.5cm diameter circles from the pastry, slightly larger than the diameter of the ramekins. Brush the edges of the ramekins with egg. Top with pastry and press down edges to seal. Place on a baking tray and bake for 20 mins or until pastry is golden and filling is cooked through. Serve with steamed greens.']

ingredient: ['150g (3/4 cup) raw buckwheat', '1 lemon, rind finely grated, juiced', '2 tbsp Cobram Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil Light Flavour', '1 tbsp white balsamic vinegar', '1 garlic clove, crushed', '2 (about 480g) lamb backstraps', '2 tbsp dukkah', '3 cups firmly packed fresh mixed herbs (mint, coriander, parsley)', '200g cherry tomatoes, quartered', '1/2 small red onion, finely chopped']
steps: ['Bring a saucepan of water to the boil over high heat. Add buckwheat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 5-6 minutes or until al dente. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Spread over a tray lined with paper towel to dry.', 'Meanwhile, place the lemon rind, juice, oil, vinegar and garlic in a screw-top jar. Season and shake to combine.', 'Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spray lamb with olive oil, then season. Cook, turning, for 6-8 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Set aside to rest for 4 minutes. Spread dukkah on a plate. Press lamb into dukkah to coat. Slice lamb.', 'Finely chop three-quarters of the herbs. Combine buckwheat, herbs, tomato, onion and half the dressing in a bowl. Serve with lamb. Drizzle with remaining dressing.']

ingredient: ['4 cups (1L) Coles Japanese Inspired Mushroom & Miso Style Broth', '270g soba noodles', '5cm-piece ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks', '1 carrot, peeled, cut into matchsticks', '1 bunch baby choy sum, cut into 5cm lengths', '200g frozen edamame or broad beans, thawed, peeled', '200g pkt honey soy tofu, thinly sliced', '2 spring onions, thinly sliced', '2 tbsp Table of Plenty Asian Black Sesame Dukkah Salad Sprinkles']
steps: ['Place the broth in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Add the noodles and cook for 3 mins or until the noodles are tender.', 'Add the ginger, carrot, choy sum and edamame or broad beans to the pan. Cook for 1 min or until the carrot is just tender and heated through.', 'Divide soup among serving bowls. Top with the tofu and spring onion. Sprinkle with dukkah to serve.']

ingredient: ['1 cup (160g) blanched almonds', '1/3 cup (75g) caster sugar', '50g butter, melted, cooled', '2 eggs, lightly beaten', 'Zest and juice of 1 orange', '2 tbsp plum jam, plus extra, to serve', '4 green figs or black figs, thinly sliced']
steps: ['For pastry, process flour, sugar and butter in a food processor until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add combined egg yolk mixture and essence and process until mixture just comes together. Form dough into a disc and freeze for 30 minutes or until firm.', 'Using the coarse side of a grater, grate pastry into a bowl. Working quickly, scatter over a greased 11 x 35cm loose-based tart tin, then press to cover base and sides evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.', 'Preheat oven to 190Â°C. Line pastry with baking paper and fill with dried rice or beans. Place on an oven tray and bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and rice and bake for a further 10 minutes or until crisp and dry. Set aside to cool.', 'Process almonds and sugar in a food processor until finely ground. Add butter, eggs, rind and juice and process until combined. Spread jam over base of tart then pour over almond mixture. Arrange figs over top. Bake for 25 minutes or until tart is puffed, covering with baking paper during the last 10 minutes to prevent over-browning. Serve brushed with extra jam.']

foodname: Garlic balsamic mushrooms with Turkish toast
ingredient: ['2 garlic cloves, crushed', '2 tbsp balsamic vinegar', '12 small flat mushrooms, stalks trimmed', 'olive oil spray', '8 slices Turkish bread, thinly sliced', '1/4 cup roughly chopped flat-leaf parsley']
steps: ['Combine garlic and balsamic vinegar. Mix well.', 'Brush mushroom tops with balsamic mixture. Spray lightly with oil. Place stalk-side up on grill tray.', 'Preheat grill on high. Grill mushrooms for 4 to 5 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a plate and keep warm. Spray bread with oil. Grill for 2 minutes on each side or until golden.', 'Arrange mushrooms and bread on serving plates. Sprinkle with parsley.']

ingredient: ['1/3 cup lemon juice', '1 1/2 cups caster sugar', '500g frozen raspberries', '1 tbsp dry apera (sherry)', '750g cream cheese, softened', '3/4 cup icing sugar mixture', '1 tbsp finely grated orange rind', '2 tbsp orange juice', '600ml thickened cream', '2 x 400g jam sponge rolls', '3 yellow peaches', '250g fresh raspberries', '1/2 tsp vanilla bean paste']
steps: ['Place lemon juice, caster sugar and frozen raspberries in a large microwave-safe glass bowl. Microwave, uncovered, on HIGH (100%), stirring every minute, for 4 minutes or until sugar has dissolved.', 'Microwave, uncovered, on HIGH (100%), stirring halfway through, for a further 12 minutes or until slightly thickened. Strain mixture through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl. Discard seeds. Cool for 30 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, make Maple Cinnamon Almonds Place almonds in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until just toasted. Add maple syrup and cinnamon. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute or until almonds are golden and toasted. Transfer to a bowl. Set aside to cool.', 'Reserve 1/3 cup of raspberry sauce. Add dry apera to remaining raspberry sauce. Stir to combine.', 'Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese, icing sugar, rind and juice until light and fluffy. Add 1 cup cream. Beat until combined.', 'Cut each sponge roll into 2cm-thick slices. Thinly slice 2 peaches. Reserve 1/4 cup fresh raspberries and 1 tablespoon almonds. Layer sponge roll slices, peach slices, remaining raspberries and almonds with dollops of cream cheese mixture and raspberry apera mixture in a 3-litre (12-cup-capacity) serving bowl.', 'Using an electric mixer, beat vanilla and remaining cream until just-soft peaks form. Thinly slice remaining peach. Layer spoonfuls of cream mixture with peach slices and reserved fresh raspberries, almonds and raspberry sauce over trifle. Serve.']

ingredient: ['300ml thickened cream', '1 tsp vanilla extract', '1/2 tsp cinnamon, plus 2 tsp extra', '2 tsp caster sugar, plus 2 tsp extra', "1 x 250g packet Arnott's Butternut Snap Cookies"]
steps: ['Place the cream, vanilla, cinnamon and sugar in a bowl and beat until stiff peaks form. Use half the cream mixture to sandwich together the biscuits and arrange standing side-by-side on a baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper to form a log. Carefully spread remaining cream mixture over entire surface of log. Roll in non-stick baking paper and refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight until set.', 'Combine extra cinnamon and sugar and scatter over a piece of non-stick baking paper. Carefully unroll the log and place on the cinnamon mixture. Using the paper to help, roll the log back and forth to coat evenly. Slice log diagonally to serve.']

foodname: Warm potato salad with cheesy sauce
ingredient: ['2kg sebago potatoes', '2 1/2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil', '4 garlic cloves, unpeeled', '125g cream cheese, chopped, softened', '1/2 cup sour cream', '1/2 cup milk', '2 tsp dijon mustard', '80g gruyere cheese, grated', '200g middle bacon rashers, trimmed, chopped', '3 green onions, thinly sliced', 'Lemon zest, to serve']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper.', 'Cut potatoes into 5cm chunks. Place in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Transfer to prepared tray. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil. Toss to coat. Season well. Roast for 40 minutes, turning potato halfway through cooking. Add garlic. Roast for a further 15 minutes or until potato is golden and tender.', 'Place cream cheese, sour cream and milk in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until melted and smooth. Squeeze garlic from skins into mixture. Add mustard and gruyère. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until golden. Remove from heat. Add onion. Stir to combine.', 'Add 3/4 of the bacon mixture to cheese sauce. Place potato in a serving bowl. Drizzle sauce over potato. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with lemon zest and remaining bacon mixture. Serve.']

ingredient: ['1/4 cup (60ml) extra virgin olive oil', '400g can chickpeas, rinsed, drained', '1 small red onion, thinly sliced', '2 celery sticks, thinly sliced', '1 small fennel, thinly sliced, fronds reserved', '1 Pink Lady apple, thinly sliced', '2 cups cooked chicken, shredded', '2 tbsp lemon juice', '1 garlic clove, crushed', '1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves']
steps: ['Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a small frying pan over medium heat. Cook the chickpeas, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until golden.', 'Arrange the onion, celery, fennel, apple and chicken on serving plates. Sprinkle with the chickpeas.', 'Combine the lemon juice, garlic and remaining oil in a small bowl. Drizzle over the salad. Sprinkle with the parsley and reserved fennel fronds. Season to serve.']

ingredient: ['800g skinless salmon fillets', '30g pkt Mexican spice mix', '1 tbsp sesame seeds', '6 wholegrain wraps', '1/2 iceberg lettuce, shredded', '1 large carrot, peeled, coarsely grated', '140g grated cheddar', '2 avocados, thinly sliced', '1 cup fresh coriander sprigs', 'Garlic aioli, to serve']
steps: ['Cut salmon into 1cm slices. Place spice mix and sesame seeds in a large sealable bag. Add salmon. Seal. Toss to coat.', 'Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray with oil. Cook salmon, in batches, for 1-2 minutes each side, until cooked.', 'Top each wrap with lettuce, carrot, cheddar, avocado, salmon, coriander and aioli. Wrap up to enclose.', 'Cook the burritos, 1 at a time, on a preheated sandwich press for 1-2 minutes, until crisp and light golden. Remove and cut in half. Drizzle with a little more aioli.']

ingredient: ['700g cauliflower, cut into small florets', '2cm piece fresh ginger, finely grated', '1/2 tsp cumin seeds', '1/2 tsp ground turmeric', '1/3 cup low-fat Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt', '2 tbsp roughly chopped fresh coriander leaves', '2 tsp lemon juice']
steps: ['Combine cauliflower, ginger, cumin and turmeric in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.', 'Place cauliflower mixture in a metal steamer. Place steamer over a large saucepan of simmering water. Cook, covered, for 8 minutes or until tender.', 'Transfer to a large bowl. Add yoghurt, coriander and lemon juice. Gently toss to combine. Serve.']

ingredient: ['40g butter', '2 tbsp olive oil', '660g (3 cups) medium-grain rice, rinsed, drained', '1/4 tsp saffron threads', '750ml (3 cups) cold water', 'Pinch of salt', '100g pistachio kernels']
steps: ['Heat the butter and oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the rice and saffron. Stir to combine.', 'Add the water and salt. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 12 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Set aside, covered, for 10 minutes to stand.', 'Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Add the pistachios and cook, stirring often, for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic. Coarsely chop. Add to the rice mixture and stir to combine. Serve warm.']

ingredient: ['800g (about 4 large) desiree potatoes', '2 onions', '45g can anchovies in olive oil', '2 x 95g cans Sirena Tuna In Rosemary Infused Oil', '40g butter', '6 sprigs thyme', '1 lemon', '300ml pouring cream', '1/4 bunch flat-leaf parsley', '15g (1/4 cup) dried breadcrumbs', '1 bunch watercress', '1 Lebanese cucumber', '2 oranges', 'Olive oil, to drizzle']
steps: ['Preheat oven to 210C. Wash potatoes, then, using a mandolin or knife, cut into julienne (matchsticks). Peel, halve and thinly slice onions. Drain anchovies and tuna, then finely chop anchovies.', 'Melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add anchovies, then strip leaves from thyme and zest lemon into pan. Reserve lemon. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until anchovies are dissolved. Add potatoes and cook, turning occasionally, for 3 minutes or until slightly softened. Add cream and toss to combine.', 'Grease 6 x 310ml (1 1/4-cup) ovenproof dishes. Divide half the potato mixture among dishes, top with tuna, then remaining potato mixture. Tear the leaves from parsley, finely chop, then combine with breadcrumbs in a bowl. Scatter over potato mixture. Bake for 25 minutes or until tops are golden.']

ingredient: ['4 tbsp (100g) penang curry paste', '1 tbsp fish sauce', '165ml can light coconut milk', '2 chicken breast fillets, cut into 2cm cubes', '1 large red capsicum, cut into 2cm pieces', '190g can sliced bamboo shoots, drained', '1 1/4 cups (250g) jasmine rice', '1/2 cup roughly chopped coriander leaves']
steps: ['Soak eight 20cm wooden skewers in hot water for 10 minutes. Mix the curry paste, fish sauce and coconut milk, then add chicken and turn to coat.', 'Thread 3 alternating pieces of capsicum, bamboo and chicken onto each skewer. Add 1/4 cup (60ml) water to remaining marinade and set aside. Cook the rice according to packet instructions, then toss with the coriander.', 'Meanwhile, heat a large frypan over medium-high heat. In batches if necessary, add the chicken skewers and cook for 1-2 minutes on each of the 4 sides.
